article_title: Corruption Currents: WikiLeaks Adds More Leaked Emails to Sony Database
article_text: The SEC recently updated its Compliance and Disclosures Interpretations (C&DIs) on non-GAAP measures in response to its increasing concerns that such measures may be misleading, more prominent than comparable GAAP measures or inconsistently presented from period to period. The C&DIs do not prohibit companies from using non-GAAP measures that comply with the SEC’s existing rules, however the regulator’s tone in the interpretations is intentionally forceful, in an effort to “send a message.”

twitter.description: WikiLeaks added even more emails from Sony Corp. to its database. (

article_summary:
The C&DIs do not prohibit companies from using non-GAAP measures that comply with the SEC’s existing rules, however the regulator’s tone in the interpretations is intentionally forceful, in an effort to “send a message.”
The SEC recently updated its Compliance and Disclosures Interpretations (C&DIs) on non-GAAP measures in response to its increasing concerns that such measures may be misleading, more prominent than comparable GAAP measures or inconsistently presented from period to period.
